Articles.Content:
I made the Kerbol system in celestia. You can\'t see Kerbol until you\'re about 5.5 LY away.

The Yellow star below Kerbin is Sol.

It took several hours to get the textures and atmosphere working, but everything is EXACTLY the same as in KSP.

Heck, I might am going to add a little capsule floating precariously close to Kerbin.

Download Version 1.3

Version History:

1.0 Original Upload

1.1 Modified Star

1.2 Modified Star (Again)

1.2.1 Fixed Orbit Period of Kerbin

1.3 Fixed Munar orbit and rotation periods, added Minmus, new Textures, Preparation for capsule

INSTRUCTIONS:

Unzip into the main directory of celestia. Celestia will automatically load the files.

In celestia, under navigation, 'Goto Object...' type Kerbol. When you\'re in the Kerbol system repeat, just this time 'Kerbin'.

TADA!

Installation Tutorial

Open ZIP file with 7Zip (Or WinRAR) and click 'Extract' (-) on the Toolbar.

Enter Celestia\'s main directory (The one with celestia.exe) and click 'Ok'

Run Celestia.
You may want to change the star type from a red dwarf to a yellow dwarf, so it doesn\'t look so overwhelmingly red.

Done!

If you downloaded it already, I\'d recommend you redo that.

Odd, it\'s not letting me add the files.

I just got Celestia, and I\'m on a Mac. Help?

You pasted it in the same folder as celestia.exe, right? All the files?

Did you try 'go to' and type 'Kerbol'?

EDIT: I posted an image tutorial.

Err, this still doesn\'t work. I found the folder and all, but when I run celestia, it becomes really blocky and square (text becomes unreadable, light is emitted in a square). I\'ve only succeeded once, and when I did, Kerbol had the Sun\'s texture, the Mun, the Moon\'s, and Kerbin was plain white. Note, though, that I am a mac. Thanks!
UPDATED! Includes Minmus, imporved textures, and very soon, a capsule orbiting Kerbin!
